summary: The Regional China Officer Authorization Act (H.R. 5329) mandates the establishment of a Regional China Officer Program Unit within the State Department to monitor and counter the People's Republic of China's global influence. The bill authorizes funding for the program, including the deployment of at least 20 Regional China Officers (RCOs) across various bureaus. These officers will assess PRC activities, advise diplomatic staff and allies, and coordinate strategies to address PRC influence. The program has a sunset clause, expiring five years after enactment. The bill defines an ally as a NATO member or a major non-NATO ally.
